title: A letter to Rito from someone who usually sides with Rito about gameplay.
body:
Not gonna lie... I defend Riot... A LOT. Probably because I find the boards overly witch-hunting... A LOT. That aside I decided to try my best to compile a list of issues for Riot to consider in upcoming patches. Most of these they already are probably working on since 8.2 is in full work, but eh.

Top Lane: People are upset at the tank only top lane. With Juggernauts and Fighters heavily outclassed. Now personally I think that it MIGHT not be 100% on runes.
With a bit of changes on who they are fighting I think Fighters like Fiora and Renek might really like Press The Attack, or at the very least it can be SLIGHTLY changed to be liked by both ranged and fighters like Fervor was. Maybe change instead of a flat further damage buff maybe something to assist in quick trades?
And for Juggernauts I can see them taking Grasp if it did just a BIT more in the offensive department, which it should since it is the ONLY offense keystone in resolve (Well aftershock but that is more of a benefit of CC than flat damage)
And also maybe giving a price reduction to Triforce. And maybe -100g on Phage and BC? maybe a small upgrade to the stats on Steraks? IDK These are just ideas.
I would also mention specific champions but raw statistics say way more than I need to speak about.

Mid Lane: Honestly im happy with Mid but from what I hear ManaFlowBand might be a bit strong.

Jungle: Honestly I dont really hear any complaints about JG right now.

Bot Lane: Alright this is the big thing Rito........ NERF ADC ITEM GOLD. I think that, what, 20 patches ago or so it was a deserved buff, ADCs back then were struggling, people seem to think their current strength takes that away from them or that they deserve being dumpstered. But back then it was indeed deserved. Now though? Not at all. I think that the Zeal items need a cost increase for sure.
"What is to stop the same thing from happening again?" Well the current support changes (while taking the 3 actives away) Allows Supports to start getting actual items much faster... Which hopefully would be enough to protect the ADC enough to survive these situations. But ADCs are getting items much to fast for being ADCs and I think a gold nerf is now deserved.

So yeah thats my 2 cents on what should be looked at in upcoming patches. Did I miss something? IDK.

> Stop pretending that in the mid lane mages are performing bad when they have the highest win rate on mid lane and have been meta pick the last season.

I can see how the way I worded it makes it seem like I meant they are bad, but that's not the case. I was trying to say that mages have 0 adaptability and don't have individuality. They might perform well as a class, but they have very little effectiveness individually in comparison to eachother. I guess what I'm getting at is that _they basically all play the same way and build the same way, with just different results because of theyre kits._

All mages, whether for burst, poke, waveclear, zoning, 1v1, dps, long range or short range, trades or all ins. It doesnt matter, everyone has the same build, no matter their purpose.

{{champion:268}} + {{item:3115}} 
or

Vladimir's core build is different because his entire kit pushes him to build tank to a degree as well, not because he's a diver.

You have burst mages building the same as zoning mages. You have mobile mages building the same way as immobile mages.

Base damage on tanks is overly generous. Aftershock just amplifies this a ton - it basically matches electrocute at level 1 while also giving you strong resistances. Tanks are the only ones who can deal with ranged harass effectively. So that's why bruisers and fighters were largely crowded out. The only alternative is full damage champs like gp.
Due to stuff like pta, aa champs can also nearly match the burst of a caster-based champ in the EARLY game when the caster-based champ should be stronger by far. But of course, Riot has decided lately that they don't like champs bullying hard early (renekton, leona, etc.). Meanwhile, hyperscaling champs are allowed to match or nearly match the power of a early game champ in the early game while scaling to the point they bully 5x as hard as they should be getting bullied early if the lane bully champ were allowed to properly do their job? Ex: taric vs leona (close battle early, taric almost matches the cc and makes team way more unkillable mid/late). Also individual durability of the champs. How is this ok? Ex: renekton vs gp, jax, fiora. So, the latter 3 can all duel with renekton early game if they aren't complete idiots about it. Miss a few cs, nothing to put them way behind. Even kill renekton if he makes a mistake or in some cases simply doesn't outplay. But can this be flipped mid/late game? Can renekton do the same thing to a fiora, jax, or gp who messes up? In your dreams. This - this inequality is what pisses people off. Let early game bullies be early game bullies. And if you won't allow that, then give them comparable scaling.
